intro: Callitropsis lusitanica, commonly known as the Lusitanian juniper, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae and is characterized by its dense, needle-like leaves and small, cone-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
